channel.title: film on underWater desert Blogging
channel.description: Recent content in film on underWater desert Blogging

item.title: Kite Runner Movie
item.description: Just found out that Mark Forster, who directed Stranger Than Fiction, Finding Neverland and Monster’s Ball is directing the film adaptation of Kite Runner. A very reputable NGO, International Rescue Group, who focuses on refugee issues among other things, has been consulting on the film. I’m not sure if that lends the film an inordinate amount of credibility, but I think that it certainly lends some. Hosseini co-wrote the screenplay so it may have a good following of the novel, which I haven’t read. It is to be released state-side the beginning of November according to IMDb.

item.title: the dude abides.
item.description: i don’t know about you….but this gives me hope.

item.title: Update.
item.description: The [New York Post][1] reports that a charity, after hearing about the horrific corporate, imperialistic exploitation of the children paid for the prosthetics. If Warner Brothers does decide to get off their fat asses, walk across their plush carpetting on their two good (but fat) legs, pick up the phone with either of their good (but plump) hands and place a call to their fat bankers to wire a measly amount of throw-away money (likely less than they spent on condiments for the Leo trailer) to these children, that the charity will instead give the money for prosthetics to 27 other deserving children.

item.title: Pirate!
item.description: i saw pirates friday night. it was….it was. not disappointing.

item.title: working on a feeling
item.description: [![740759036_l_1][2]][2] tonight i saw this movie. you should too. it contains a decent soundtrack and one of my favorite vehicles for a narrative framework: the roadtrip. some of the scenes in it were so spot on i didn’t know what to do. i lapsed in to an analysis of the femine/masculine perspectives on life but was torn out of it when i realized that all the women around me were laughing at the things happening just as often as i was.

item.title: cities
item.description: tiny cities ARE made of ashes.
